1262396631334432768.text: H.R. 3981 would create an easily understood food date labeling system—“BEST If Used By” to communicate that the quality of the food product may begin to deteriorate after the date & “USE By” to communicate the estimated shelf life after which the product should not be consumed.

1262395138288029697.text: Date labeling regulations are left up to states, which means consumers are left trying to sort out a patchwork of confounding terms. “Sell by,” “use by,” “freshest on,” and “expires on” are just a few of the phrases currently being used on food products.

1262394518684532736.text: 40% of all food produced in the U.S. is wasted, costing our nation $161 billion annually. It is estimated that if all food waste represented an individual country, it would be the third largest emitter of greenhouse gases globally.

1262393698689650690.text: ~90% of Americans prematurely throw out perfectly safe food, in part because of confusion about what date labels mean, meanwhile 38.4M Americans are food insecure. H.R. 3981 would to reduce confusion & make sure no one is going hungry or inadvertently hurting our environment.

1133854936226324485.text: This President’s unwillingness to cooperate with Congress, particularly on a matter relating to a foreign attack on our democracy, is an insult to our system of coequal branches of government.

1133854863740362752.text: The 116th Congress has been stonewalled at every turn by President Trump and his allies as we’ve exercised our legitimate oversight power seeking answers on Russian interference in our elections and other matters.
